name: Let's get to know each other and talk about DevFest 2018!
description:
• What we'll do
We will introduce ourselves and discuss the different options (location, time, audience, impact etc.) in regards to Google's DevFest that would be hosted by us.
how_to_find_us: Send Anguel a text at 07426315115 when you're outside and he will come get you

name: The DevFest Is Here At Last!

venue.name: Sir Alwyn Williams Building - Level 5 meeting room

description:
• What we'll do

GDG DevFest is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, and more!

This DevFest consists of speakers sessions on Android, Firebase, Google Cloud and ML, Google Actions, and Tensorflow. Leading after it, there is a workshop for 2 hours.

Agenda:
10:00 AM Registration & Welcome Coffee
10:30 AM Talk: Introduction to Android
11:10 AM Talk: What's the hype about Tensorflow
11:50 AM Talk: Google Cloud and ML
12:30 PM Lunch time / Networking
13:00 PM Talk: Google Actions
13:45 PM Talk: Firebase
14:30 PM Coffee Break / Networking
14:45 PM Hands on session: Workshops on all technologies
16:45 PM Closing & End of the Event Networking

More information will be available on the site as soon as it becomes available.
* https://gdg-glasgow.com/

• What to bring

Please bring your laptops with Android Studio and Tensorflow for their respective workshops.

• How to buy tickets?

The tickets will be available next week (starting 5th February) on Eventbrite. The tickets will go in batches so stay tuned to get yours! The link for the tickets is here:

* https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/gdg-glasgow-devfest-tickets-42732058738

Check out our Facebook event! Hit the interest button to get all the updates of the event!

* https://www.facebook.com/events/178473089578586/?ti=as

Note: the schedule is subject to change if there is a change in timings or speakers.

name: GDG Glasgow Introduction to Andoid
description:
Google Developers Glasgow are excited to announce our next event!
We will learn about Android fundamentals with J.P.Morgan developers, have a networking session, - just spend our Thursday evening productively!

*This is a free event but the number of spaces is limited. Get your tickets here:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/gdg-glasgow-android-night-tickets-49254030130

name: GDG Glasgow DevFest 2018
description:
GDG DevFest is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, workshops, and more!

Speaker information is available here!
https://devfest.gdg-glasgow.com/speakers

The talks include:
Google Apps Script
Flutter
Golang
Google Assistant
Video delivery optimisation

The schedule is as follows:
Agenda DevFest 2018 – 2019
10.00 – 10.30 Registration, breakfast
10:30 – 10:45 Introduction to GDG and partners
10.45 – 11.40 What Is Flutter and Why Is It Disruptive to Mobile
11.40 – 11.45 Questions on the talk
11:45 – 11:50 Break
11.50 – 12.45 All about Google Apps Script
12.45 – 12.50 Questions on the talk
12.50 – 12.55 Break
12.55 – 13.35 Lunch
13.35 – 14.25 It’s Time to Stop Stalling: Delivering Fast Video without the Buffering
14.25 – 14.30 Questions on the talk
14.30 – 14.35 Break
14.35 – 15.25 Google Assistant: Interactions and Sentiments Aiding
15.25 – 15.30 Questions on the talk
15.30 – 15.35 Break
15.35 – 16.25 Reinforcement Learning with Deep Mind
16.25 – 16.30 Questions on the talk
16.30 – 16.40 Break
16.40 – 17.30 Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) with Google
17.30 – 17.40 Questions on the talk
17.40 – 19.00 Networking

Tickets are available here:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/gdg-glasgow-devfest-2018-tickets-48817803364
how_to_find_us: Go to the front of the University of Glasgow, across the road that leads to the library. There are two main gates that are always open. Walk directly through the gates and head forward. There will be a sign posted about where the event will be.

name: Google Hash Code 2019 Qualification Round
description:
GDG Glasgow and the Glasgow University Competitive Programming Society would like to present the Google Hash Code 2019 Qualification Round!

Hash Code is a team programming competition, organised by Google, for students and professionals around the world.

We welcome everyone to form a team and then sign up at the link here: https://hashcodejudge.withgoogle.com/#/home

The hub name is "Google Developer Group Glasgow Hub United Kingdom".

Venue will be within the University of Glasgow and will be posted once updated.
